timeline.message:
rename SetPoint to Setpoint

Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS <jlabous@silicom.fr>

change to prevent breaking changes

Signed-off-by: Jérémy LABOUS <jlabous@silicom.fr>

timeline.bodyText:
Add a default implementation:
default double getVoltageSetPoint() { return getVoltageSetpoint(); }
timeline.author: MioRtia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -51,15 +51,32 @@ *

Depends on the working variant.

* @return the voltage setpoint */ + default double getVoltageSetpoint() { + return getVoltageSetpoint(); + } + + /** + * @deprecated use {@link #getVoltageSetpoint()} instead. + */ + @Deprecated

timeline.author: MioRtia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -51,15 +51,32 @@ *

Depends on the working variant.

* @return the voltage setpoint */ + default double getVoltageSetpoint() { + return getVoltageSetpoint(); + } + + /** + * @deprecated use {@link #getVoltageSetpoint()} instead. + */ + @Deprecated double getVoltageSetPoint(); + /** *

Set the voltage setpoint in Kv.

*

Needed only when regulating mode is set to {@link RegulationMode#VOLTAGE}.

*

Depends on the working variant.

- * @param voltageSetPoint the voltage setpoint + * @param voltageSetpoint the voltage setpoint * @return this to allow method chaining */ + default StaticVarCompensator setVoltageSetpoint(double voltageSetpoint) { + return setVoltageSetPoint(voltageSetpoint); + } + + /** + * @deprecated use {@link #setVoltageSetpoint(double voltageSetpoint)} instead. + */ + @Deprecated

timeline.author: MioRtia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,15 +85,31 @@ *

Depends on the working variant.

* @return the reactive power setpoint */ + default double getReactivePowerSetpoint() { + return getReactivePowerSetPoint(); + } + + /** + * @deprecated use {@link #getReactivePowerSetpoint()} instead. + */ + @Deprecated

timeline.author: MioRtia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -68,15 +85,31 @@ *

Depends on the working variant.

* @return the reactive power setpoint */ + default double getReactivePowerSetpoint() { + return getReactivePowerSetPoint(); + } + + /** + * @deprecated use {@link #getReactivePowerSetpoint()} instead. + */ + @Deprecated double getReactivePowerSetPoint(); /** *

Set the reactive power setpoint in MVAR.

*

Needed only when regulating mode is set to {@link RegulationMode#REACTIVE_POWER}.

*

Depends on the working variant.

- * @param reactivePowerSetPoint the reactive power setpoint + * @param reactivePowerSetpoint the reactive power setpoint * @return this to allow method chaining */ + default StaticVarCompensator setReactivePowerSetpoint(double reactivePowerSetpoint) { + throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Not implemented"); + } + + /** + * @deprecated use {@link #setReactivePowerSetpoint(double reactivePowerSetpoint)} instead. + */ + @Deprecated

timeline.bodyText: Rather than that, the default implementation should call the deprecated method
timeline.author: MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: Add deprecated javadoc and a default implementation calling the new method
timeline.author: MioRtia
MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: If you add a default implementation to the deprecated method, you will not have to code an implementation here
timeline.author: MioRtia
MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: If you add a default implementation in the interface, you wil not have to implement the deprecated method here
timeline.author: MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: Same remark as above, you can delete the implementations of deprecated methods if they have default implementations in the interface
timeline.author: MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia
MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: Not sure why you are using AtomicReference here?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Because we need to use final attribute in lamba expression.
replies.author: jlabous

replies.bodyText: Okay, I would rather use a String[] voltageSetpoinName = new String[1]; in this case
